meanings.definition: To transplant tissue from one part of the body to another in the same individual.
meanings.sent1: She autografted skin from her thigh to cover the burn on her arm.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon autografted bone to repair the fracture in the patient's leg.
meanings.sent3: John joked that he could autograft his hair from his head to his chin for a beard.
meanings.sent4: The idea of autografting memories from one's past to the present is intriguing.
meanings.sent5: Autografting a plant cutting to a new pot is like giving it a fresh start.

meanings.definition: The act of transplanting tissue from one part of the body to another in the same individual.
meanings.sent1: The autografted skin healed quickly after the surgery.
meanings.sent2: An autografted organ can reduce the risk of rejection in transplant patients.
meanings.sent3: The concept of autografting fascinated the medical students in class.
meanings.sent4: The autografted tissue became fully integrated with the recipient's body.
meanings.sent5: The success of the autografted procedure brought hope to many patients.
